result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton L Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: with any other probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  

No contact with Victim A, her family or her residence, directly or through any third party.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   
Victim A appeared in court by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Victim A presented a statement to the court.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to: any other probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim A, her family or her residence, directly or through any third party..
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Bryce Butryn, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Thurston .
Cross examination by attorney Meyeroff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and requests to disimss count 1.
DDA Thurston presents counter arugments. 
Attorney Meyeroff presents counter arugments.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on April 11th, 2022.
Hearing on April 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Proposed Protective order
The original document name was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 04-11-2022

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to utilize any social media.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:13 PM Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Griffis appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as he was not on the list.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
